attributes.comment:
I am strongly opposed to the proposed fee increases to the Immigration Benefit
Application/ Petition and Biometric Fee Schedule. As a prospective adoptive
parent, we have already spent tens of thousands of dollars trying to bring our
daughter home from Vietnam. We are a middle-class american family, and
needless to say, the cost has made a significant impact on our finances.
Granted, many of those fees are not anything the U.S. government has control
over, but some of them are directly related to USCIS policies. The United States
is known throughout the world for its compassion towards the needy, yet our
govenment seems determined to make it even more difficult for individual citizens
to extend one of the greatest expressions of compassion - adoption - to a orphan
child. Of particular frustration to those of us in the adoption community is the
fact that our fingerprints and I-600A often expire before we have the chance to
bring our children home. This rate increase would then mean a total of $320 for 2
parents to get fingerprinted twice, and a whopping $1340 for filing the I-600A
twice! That is quite a financial burden to impose on those whose primary goal is
to help a child! I urge you to avoid discouraging U.S. citizens from adopting
internationally by raising these fees, and imagine how many more children could
be impacted by the love of americans if only the cost weren't so exorbinant.
Thank you!

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Laura M. Tagliere
